intro: Caucalis grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered caucalis, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a peppery scent when crushed. Caucalis grandiflora is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is often used in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
